Docs.param: The value of the Literal node.
Docs.summary: Creates a new Literal with the given value not associated with a KnowledgeModel.

MemberSignature.Value: public Literal (string value, string language, string dataType);

Docs.param: The value of the Literal node.
A language identifier, or to leave the language unspecified.
The URI that gives the datatype of the literal, or to leave the specific datatype unspecified.
Docs.summary: Creates a new Literal with the given value, language, and datatype.
Docs.remarks: A language and datatype cannot both be specified according to the RDF standard; however, SemWeb will accept such literals.

Docs.value: The string value of the literal.
The language identifier of the literal, or .

Docs.summary: The datatype URI of the literal.
Docs.value: The datatype URI of the literal, or .

MemberSignature.Value: public static SemWeb.Literal Parse (string literal, SemWeb.NamespaceManager namespaces);

Docs.param: An N3-encoded form of a literal.
A namespace manager used to resolve the literal's datatype, if present.
Docs.remarks: The encoded literal is in the form of: "value"[^^datatypeURI|@langcode].

Docs.param: The string value to convert to a Literal object.
Docs.summary: Converts a string to a Literal object whose language and datatype are null.
Docs.returns: A literal object whose Value is the string, and whose language and datatype are null.

Docs.summary: Uses the DataType of the literal to turn it into a native .NET type.
Docs.returns: A string, boolean, integer, or other value, as described below.

remarks.para: If the DataType of the literal is not set, or if the DataType is not one of the following recognized types, the literal's string value is returned.
The recognized types below are all in the http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema# namespace. That is, where it says "string" below, it means the DataType is http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#string.

item.description: A , true if the literal's value is "true" or "1", false otherwise.

item.term: decimal, integer, positiveInteger, nonPositiveInteger, negativeInteger, nonNegativeInteger
item.description: The literal's value as a using .
The literal's value as a for float or for double, using the appropriate Parse method.
The literal's value as a using .
The literal's value as a using .
The literal's value as a , , , or using the appropriate Parse method.
The literal's value as a , , , or using the appropriate Parse method.

Docs.summary: A literal (text string) node in an RDF graph.

remarks.para: Literals are string values optionally with a language string or datatype URI.
An implicit conversion operator is defined from strings to literals. The operator converts the string to a literal by returning a literal with that value, and language and datatype.
